channel.title: My Dungeoneering
channel.description:
One of the people I develop for every once in awhile asked me to do a Dungeoneering project so I decided to work on one.
After spending some time working on it I ended up with a pretty decent result of which includes the following:
[B][U]Entrance:[/U][/B] NO Items/Armour/Equipment allow per entry. Player count can be any amount no 4-player cut off. Each player is spawn with 350GP. [img]http://puu.sh/cRNfu/2a726880da.jpg[/img]
[B][U]Start:[/U][/B] There is a shop near you which sells the following: Fishing Resources Knife Hammer Bronze Bars Feathers [img]http://puu.sh/cRNi1/d28c08db90.jpg[/img]
You can make full bronze here with the anvil located right across from you.
[B][U]Dungeon:[/U][/B] I decided to use the whole Rogue's Den to house our Dungeoneering course. This dungeon basically consists on the following things: [B]Farming NPCs:[/B] NPCs to get items like axes, pickaxes, etc. [img]http://puu.sh/cRNvH/8dcfa5ee0d.jpg[/img] [B]Mini-Bosses:[/B] Bosses ran into most oftenly, their Health, Attack, Defence, and amount of spawns depend on the Complexity (which depends on the player count). [img]http://puu.sh/cRNsR/f7efd8cf0e.jpg[/img] [B]End Boss:[/B] This is the only boss that is actually *required* to finish the dungeon, however you will get much lower XP and Points this way compared to even defeating let's say one mini-boss. [img]http://puu.sh/cRNCD/ff071425ab.jpg[/img] [B]Resource Areas:[/B] These grant access to Trees, Rocks, and other things to make, fish, cut your own item(s). [img]http://puu.sh/cRNyC/5d287012c7.jpg[/img]
End: You recieve XP and Points based on how many Mini-Bosses you killed. [img]http://puu.sh/cRNEY/c0b30c60c0.jpg[/img]
Kind of hard to explain through text, however I am making a video to show how much of a grind this really is.
[SPOILER=PAINT SKILLZ] [img]http://puu.sh/cROhr/f73bddc72b.jpg[/img] [/spoiler]

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Vain_:

who says a furnace has to be near the ores? this would make it more of a task.

This is a good point. Furnaces and anvils next to each other makes sense though.

Read full topic

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:11, topic:547847”]who says a furnace has to be near the ores? this would make it more of a task.

or you can set the basic resource objects by the dungeon start. similar to runescape.

as for the sizing. objects have a set size that the server can read. if you define areas or rooms, you can set bounds for spawning objects. and if the object can fit there, spawn there[/quote]

I see your point and understand what you’re saying I just decided to go that route with my version of it. But I’m sure additions like you, and others above stated would make it even more unique.

Read full topic

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

who says a furnace has to be near the ores? this would make it more of a task.

or you can set the basic resource objects by the dungeon start. similar to runescape.

as for the sizing. objects have a set size that the server can read. if you define areas or rooms, you can set bounds for spawning objects. and if the object can fit there, spawn there

Read full topic

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:9, topic:547847”]would be a lot cooler to use the construct map region packet to create custom map palettes.

also I wouldn’t define the rooms such as you did. add some randomness to it/room system.[/quote]

While I agree if I knew how to utilize it I’m sure I could make it into something better, however this is my first time working on this skill in-particular so I wanted to see if I could at least pull this off before I tried to advance it any further.

The whole problem with making each room randomize which type of benefit it has with this current map is that some of the areas would be too small to try to fit resources in, including the things you may need to further the resource (IE. Furnace, Spinning Wheel).

Elrick:

This is pretty damn cool!

Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

would be a lot cooler to use the construct map region packet to create custom map palettes.

also I wouldn’t define the rooms such as you did. add some randomness to it/room system.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

This is pretty damn cool!

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

Loveandpower:

On the image with spikes on the floor it would be sweet if you took damage from walking on it.

Yes, that would be a neat feature and accomplish able by a simple isIn boolean, I just don’t know if it being the first mini-boss it would be good as the player doesn’t have much to start with. Then again it’s not as fun if people are dying continuously.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

On the image with spikes on the floor it would be sweet if you took damage from walking on it.

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

lare69:

i LOVE when people do shit like this, instead of adding the actual maps you take something already existing and put your own spin on it. always been a fan of custom content, good job

Thank you, glad you like it.

Read full topic

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

Strucker:

tbh i like it, once i started a project on stronghold security :D, you should add tables with some items on them, just an advice

I started on something like this, however it is a room that was in there with Safes, every time a party goes in it can be used up to 8 times to receive items, but after that it’s empty. I like your idea and this is no means completely finished.

Read full topic

item.title: My Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

One of the people I develop for every once in awhile asked me to do a Dungeoneering project so I decided to work on one.

After spending some time working on it I ended up with a pretty decent result of which includes the following:

[B][U]Entrance:[/U][/B]
NO Items/Armour/Equipment allow per entry.
Player count can be any amount no 4-player cut off.
Each player is spawn with 350GP.

[B][U]Start:[/U][/B]
There is a shop near you which sells the following:
Fishing Resources
Knife
Hammer
Bronze Bars
Feathers

You can make full bronze here with the anvil located right across from you.

[B][U]Dungeon:[/U][/B]
I decided to use the whole Rogue’s Den to house our Dungeoneering course.
This dungeon basically consists on the following things:
[B]Farming NPCs:[/B] NPCs to get items like axes, pickaxes, etc.

[B]Mini-Bosses:[/B] Bosses ran into most oftenly, their Health, Attack, Defence, and amount of spawns depend on the Complexity (which depends on the player count).

[B]End Boss:[/B] This is the only boss that is actually required to finish the dungeon, however you will get much lower XP and Points this way compared to even defeating let’s say one mini-boss.

[B]Resource Areas:[/B] These grant access to Trees, Rocks, and other things to make, fish, cut your own item(s).

End:
You recieve XP and Points based on how many Mini-Bosses you killed.

Kind of hard to explain through text, however I am making a video to show how much of a grind this really is.

[SPOILER=PAINT SKILLZ]

[/spoiler]

Read full topic
